definition: to abandon restraint/to do as one pleases/comfortable (dialect)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to abandon restraint and have a fling (idiom)

sentences.english: The government is riding roughshod over the people's rights.
sentences.chinese: 政府恣意妄爲不顧人民的權利。

sentences.english: Do wild zhuang kill sent home.
The damage to the painting is the work of vandals .
sentences.chinese: 毀壞這幅畫的事是恣意破壞公物的人乾的。

sentences.english: Paid no attention, allowed emotion to leave unscrupulously and invisibly how much recollection.
sentences.chinese: 不經意間，任情感恣意，無形中留下了多少回憶。

sentences.english: He worked with China to get new sanctions on rogue North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 他還與中國一起，對恣意妄爲的朝鮮實施新的制裁。

sentences.english: We need to consider the problem of vandalism within ar context.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須在更廣的範圍裏考慮恣意破壞公物這個問題。

sentences.english: Offense and defense and also excellent free-kick Kung Fu kick.
sentences.chinese: 攻守俱佳的同時還有一腳出色的恣意球功夫。

sentences.english: Gone were the days when they could do what they liked to the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 他們對中國人民恣意妄爲的歲月一去不復返了。

sentences.english: On Christmas Eve, people dance and sing around Christmas tree merrymaking.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕之夜，人們圍着聖誕樹唱歌舞蹈，恣意高興。

sentences.english: The trouble is that such profligate investment is largely wasted.
sentences.chinese: 問題是，如此恣意的投資多被浪費掉了。

sentences.english: Japan will reap as it has sown, if it continues to act recklessly.
sentences.chinese: 日方如繼續恣意妄爲，必將自食其果。

sentences.english: The era of the free-spending Indian consumer is not here quite yet.
sentences.chinese: 印度消費者恣意揮霍的時代尚未到來。

sentences.english: Wind affairs-arbitrary strength, mushroom provoking satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 寒風恣意勁，香菇惹人怡。

definition: to indulge in something to one's heart's content/wanton or willful
to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
unrestrained/cheerful lack of inhibition, esp. for drinking or sleeping/to drink with abandon
to do sth to one's heart's content
